title: Socialist president, Ricardo Lagos, elected in Chile
George W. Bush and Al Gore take Iowa caucuses in U.S. presidential race
Austria at center of European dispute after conservative People's Party forms coalition with the far-right Freedom Party, headed by xenophobe Jörg Haider
First Lady Hillary Clinton officially enters N.Y. Senate race
Hijackers seize Afghan plane; release hostages in Stansted, England
Britain ends self-rule in Northern Ireland after Irish Republican Army misses disarmament deadline
NEAR spacecraft becomes first to orbit an asteroid
Wary investors cause stock plunge; beginning of the end of the Internet stock boom
Reformists win control of Iranian parliament for first time since 1979 Islamic revolution
Gun maker Smith & Wesson limits the manufacture and distribution of handguns in light of lawsuits
Mass murder or suicide of hundreds in Ugandan doomsday cult
Acting Russian president Vladimir V. Putin formally chosen for post
Microsoft loses antitrust suit; appeal expected
Controversial Osprey plane crash kills 19 marines
Cuban boy Elián González reunited with father after federal raid of Miami relatives' home
Vermont approves same-sex unions
“I love you” virus disrupts computers worldwide
South Carolina removes Confederate battle flag from capitol dome
Chile ends Augusto Pinochet's immunity, clearing way for trial on murder and torture charges during years as dictator
Israeli troops withdraw from Lebanese security zone after 22 years of occupation
Former Indonesian president Suharto under house arrest, charged with corruption and abuse of power
Britain restores parliamentary powers to Northern Ireland after Sinn Fein agrees to disarm
Presidents of North and South Korea sign peace accord, ending half-century of antagonism
British find 58 bodies of illegal Asian immigrants suffocated in Dutch truck that transported them
Elián González returns to Cuba with father
U.S. navy resumes shelling exercises of Puerto Rico's Vieques Island, used as a training site
Human genome deciphered; expected to revolutionize the practice of medicine
Iraq believed to resume missile program

Bashar al-Assad succeeds late father, Hafez al-Assad, as Syrian president

Democratic convention selects Vice President Al Gore and Sen. Joseph I. Lieberman to head ticket
Los Alamos scientist Wen Ho Lee, accused of stealing sensitive nuclear weapons data, freed after serving nine months in prison
Olympic Games open in Australia
Six-year Whitewater investigation of the Clintons ends without indictments
Yugoslav opposition claims victory; incumbent Slobodan Milosevic denies results
Danish voters reject euro
Abortion pill, RU-486, wins U.S. approval
Palestinians and Israelis clash, spurred by visit of right-wing Israeli leader Ariel Sharon to a joint Jewish/Muslim holy site; “Al Aksa intifada” continues unabated

Republicans file federal suit to block manual recount of Florida presidential election ballots sought by Democrats
Philippine president Joseph Estrada impeached after receiving gambling payoffs
Florida Supreme Court rules hand count of presidential ballots may continue
Global warming talks collapse at Hague conference

Mad Cow disease alarms Europe

U.S. Supreme Court orders halt to manual recount of presidential votes in Florida
